datasetPresenter.name: pvivPvl01_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome Sequence and annotation for Plasmodium vivax-like Pvl01
datasetPresenter.description: Genome sequence and annotation of a Plasmodium vivax-like isolate obtained from an infected chimpanzee in Gabon.

datasetPresenter.name: pfalTG01_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome Sequence and annotation for Plasmodium falciparum TG01
datasetPresenter.description:
Genome sequence and annotation for Plasmodium falciparum TG01

Illumina and Pacific Biosciences sequencing platforms were used to sequence high molecular weight DNA (6 – 20 ug). For Illumina sequencing libraries were generated from 0.5 ug of DNA using the PCR-free method. Libraries were sequenced using the MiSeq Illumina platform with 250 bp paired end reads and a fragment length of 500 bp. For the Pacific Biosciences SMRT technology, an ~8 kb fraction was selected and sequenced using P6 polymerase and version 4 chemistry (P6/C4).

The raw reads from Pacific Bioscience sequencing were assembled using HGAP version 2.3, using default parameters and a genome size of 23.5 Mb. Post HGAP, the assembly was improved to resolve overlaps, order contigs, and circularize the apicoplast and mitochondrial genomes using a bash script (IPA v1; https://github.com/ThomasDOtto/IPA). The contig set was annotated with Companion against a Pf3D7 reference version from June 2015. Finally, manual curation using Artemis, version 16.0.9, was carried out to correct the over prediction of coding sequences, to manually curate var genes, to insert missing genes such as EBA-165, to rename some gene products and to correct some gene borders.

datasetPresenter.name: ppraG01_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome Sequence and annotation for Plasmodium praefalciparum strain G01
datasetPresenter.description: Plasmodium falciparum, the most virulent agent of human malaria, shares a recent common ancestor with other members of the Laverania subgenus. However, none of the chimp and gorilla species are capable of establishing repeated infection and transmission in humans. Little has been known about the other primate parasites so to elucidate underlying mechanisms and the evolutionary history of this subgenus, Otto et al. have generated multiple genomes from all known Laverania species including the chimp parasite Plasmodium praefalciparum.

link.text: Genomes of an entire Plasmodium subgenus reveal paths to virulent human malaria

datasetPresenter.name: pcynM_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome Sequence and annotation for Plasmodium cynomolgi strain M
datasetPresenter.description: Genome sequence and annotation for Plasmodium cynomolgi strain M This Plasmodium cynomolgi M strain (PcyM) genome assembly is comprises only 56 pieces, no gaps and an improved average gene length. Detailed manual curation has ensured a comprehensive annotation of the genome with 6,632 genes. This assembly also has significant coverage of the subtelomeric regions, which account for nearly 40% of the sequence. The subtelomeres include more than 1300 Plasmodium interspersed repeat ( pir) genes, as well as a striking expansion of 36 methyltransferase pseudogenes that originated from a single copy on chromosome 9.

datasetPresenter.name: pknoMalayanPk1A_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome Sequence and annotation for Plasmodium knowlesi strain Malayan Strain Pk1 A
datasetPresenter.description:
Genome sequence and annotation for Plasmodium knowlesi strain Malayan Strain Pk1 A
PacBio-based assembly that was corrected using Illumina HiC. Contigs in scaffolds are connected by gaps represented by runs of 100 N's. PacBio reads belonging to this assembly came from SRA runs SRR5413213- SRR5413218. Illumina HiC reads were deposited in SRA accession SRR5413221. Scaffold naming is based on the length of each scaffold in order of shortest to longest.

##Genome-Assembly-Data-START##
Assembly Method :: SMRT v. 2.3.0; HGAP3 v. May 2015
Assembly Name :: PKNOHv1
Genome Coverage :: 151x
Sequencing Technology :: PacBio; Illumina HiC
##Genome-Assembly-Data-END##

EuPathDB downloaded the data from GenBank.

datasetPresenter.name: prelSGS1-like_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome sequence and annotation for Plasmodium relictum SGS1-like
datasetPresenter.description:
A de novo genome assembly of P. relictum SGS1-like was produced using an amplification-free Illumina library of 400-600 base pair prepared from the genomic DNA of infected mosquito midguts and 150bp paired end reads were generated on an Illumina MiSeq. Genes were identified ab initio and by transferring gene models from other published Plasmodium assemblies.

A publication describing the new assembly is in preparation and permission should therefore be obtained before undertaking genome-scale or chromosome-wide analysis.

This work was funded by the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute. The DNA was provided by Ana Rivero (MIVEGEC (CNRS UMR 5290), Montpellier, France). The assembly was performed by Thomas Dan Otto.
datasetPresenter.releasePolicy: This genome is actively curated at GeneDB. User comments added to this gene will be reviewed and incorporated into the official annotation if appropriate.

link.text: Complete avian malaria parasite genomes reveal host-specific parasite evolution in birds and mammals

datasetPresenter.name: pgabSY75_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome sequence and annotation of Plasmodium gaboni strain SY75
datasetPresenter.description: The SY75 P. gaboni genome was derived from a blood sample collected from a sanctuary chimpanzee (Pan troglodytes troglodytes) in West-Central Cameroon. Total DNA was extracted from erythrocytes purified by Lymphoprep density gradient centrifugation. The total DNA was then enriched for Plasmodium gDNA by methylation dependent digestion and selective whole genome amplification (SWGA). Sequencing libraries were prepared using Illumina TruSeq PCR-Free and Illumina Nextera Mate Pair kits. Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina MiSeq. The genome was assembled by reference-guided de novo assembly (using Pf3D7 as a reference) with post-assembly genome improvements. Detailed methods can be found in Sundararaman et al., 2016.

datasetPresenter.name: EMP_Bee_Microbiome_OTU_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Bee Microbiome
datasetPresenter.description: Bee Microbiome

datasetPresenter.name: pcoaHackeri_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome sequence and annotation of Plasmodium coatneyi strain Hackeri
datasetPresenter.description:
The complete (nontelomeric) genome sequence of Plasmodium coatneyi strain Hackeri was generated by the application of only Pacific Biosciences RS II (PacBio RS II) single-molecule real-time (SMRT) high-resolution sequence technology. The genome was assembled using the Hierarchical Genome Assembly Process (HGAP). De novo gene prediction was performed using SNAP and Augustus for gene calls in the MAKER2 genome annotation tool.

Assembly Method :: Hierarchical Genome Assembly Process (HGAP3)
Genome Coverage :: 51.42x
Sequencing Technology :: PacBio RSII instrument using P6-C4 chemistry

datasetPresenter.name: pfraNilgiri_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Plasmodium fragile strain nilgiri Genome Sequence and Annotation with apicoplast.
datasetPresenter.description: The old world monkey parasite Plasmodium fragile, strain nilgiri (originating from Macaca radiata, Nilgiri Hills, India 1961) was sequenced, assembled and annotated by the Broad institute (100 genome project).  Annotation of the genome was automatically performed with little or no manual curation.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_microarrayAntibody_Crompton_Mali_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Protein targets of serum antibodies in response to infection
datasetPresenter.summary: Protein targets of antibodies in response to P. falciparum infection were determined by protein microarray hybridized with plasma collected from human malaria patients.
datasetPresenter.description: Plasma collected from human subjects before and after the 6-month Mali malaria season (220 individuals) was hybridized to protein microarrays containing ~23% of the P. falciparum proteome, negative and positive controls and an IgG standard curve. Antibody binding to the protein microarray was detected by streptavidin-conjugated SureLight P-3. Antibody profiles for each patient were generated and significant differential antibody reactivity was calculated.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_microarrayAntibody_Kazura_Reinfection_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Treatment-time to reinfection cohort from Kisumu area, Kenya collected in 2003
datasetPresenter.summary: Protein microarrays were probed with plasma from residents of a community in Kenya monitored for 12 weeks for reinfection and symptomatic malaria after administration of antimalarial drugs.
datasetPresenter.description: Protein microarrays were probed with plasma from residents of a community in Kenya monitored for 12 weeks for reinfection and symptomatic malaria after administration of antimalarial drugs. P. falciparum proteins recognized by Abs from 88 children, aged 1-14 years, and 86 adults, aged 18 years, measured at the beginning of the observation period, were ranked by Ab signal intensity.

link.text: Am J Trop Med Hyg 2015 ICEMR issue

datasetPresenter.name: pyoeyoelii17X_Kappe_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Salivary gland sporozoite transcriptomes: WT vs. Puf2-KO
datasetPresenter.summary: RNA from wild type or Puf2 knockout P. yoelii 17XNL salivary gland sporozoites was analyzed by Illumina RNA sequencing.
datasetPresenter.description: The direct and indirect targets of Puf2 in early P. yoelii salivary gland sporozoites (taken from mosquitoes at t=14d) were assessed by comparative RNA-seq between wild-type and puf2- parasites. RNA was prepared from double purified salivary gland sporozoites and paired-end libraries were sequenced using Illumina techniques.

datasetPresenter.name: _massSpec_Kappe_Sprotozoite_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Salivary gland sporozoite total, N-acetyl-, phospho- and surface proteomes (NF54)
datasetPresenter.summary: Total, N-acetylated, phosphorylated and putative surface proteomes of P. falciparum N54 salivary gland sporozoites.
datasetPresenter.description:
Plasmodium falciparum N54 sporozoites were micro-dissected from mosquito salivary glands and purified to remove mosquito debris. Sporozoite proteins were fractionated by 1DE and analyzed by LC-MS/MS as whole cell lysates (total proteome) or as purified surface biotinylated proteins (surface-exposed proteome).

Samples:
sg-sporozoite: total sporozoite proteome (PMID 23325771)
surface proteins: purified biotinylated surface proteome (PMID 23325771)
phosphorylated total proteome: (PMID:28759593)
n-acetylated total proteome: (PMID:28759593)


NOTE: Care should be taken with peptide matches against P. berghei genes since the biological samples were only derived from P. falciparum and P. yoelii. The P. berghei genome annotation was used to make peptide matches/inferred protein IDs for P. yoelii and no attempt was made to use P. berghei sporozoites for this study.

datasetPresenter.name: pberANKA_microarrayExpression_Waters_DOZI_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: mRNA abundance was compared between DOZI (development of zygote inhibited) mutant and wild type P. berghei ANKA strains.
datasetPresenter.description: The full extent of the effect of DOZI (development of zygote inhibited) depletion on steady-state mRNAs of blood-stage, unactivated gametocytes was analyzed with an oligonucleotide microarray that consisted of 5283 P. berghei gene models. EuPathDB obtained the data series GSE5889 obtained from Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO).

datasetPresenter.name: metaboliteProfiles_LlinasMetabolites_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Glutamine metabolite and compound composition of P. falciparum 3D7 infected RBC, isolated parasites, and uninfected RBC extracts determined by mass spectrometry. The effect of pH on steady-state metabolite levels and glutamine metabolism was measured.
datasetPresenter.description:
In this experiment infected RBCs, isolated parasites, and uninfected RBCs were incubated for 4 hours in RPMI containing U-13 C glutamine at pH 6.4, 7.4, and 8.4. Extracts were analyzed by mass spectrometry. The effect of pH on steady-state metabolite levels and glutamine metabolism was measured.

Sample preparation details.
Ten 50 mL flasks of synchronous 3D7 infected cultures were grown to 7% parasitemia. At ~38-42 hours post invasion, infected RBCs (iRBCs) were enriched using a Percoll 70/30 density gradient. Subsequent sample preparation steps were conducted at 4 °C to minimize metabolic activity prior to the start of the experiment. Infected cells were diluted to 5% Hct in RPMI and split into 9 equal volume aliquots (BB__see sample Key). Saponin-purified parasites were prepared by lysing Percoll-enriched iRBCs in 0.02% saponin. All samples (saponin, iRBC, and uRBC) were centrifuged (10 min, 2,000 × G), the media was aspirated off, and samples were suspended in RPMI media containing 2 mM U-13 C glutamine (no unlabeled glutamine) titrated to pH 6.4, 7.4 or 8.4. Samples were then aliquoted into 24 well plates (1 ml per well). At time 0, samples were transferred to a 37°C incubator (5% CO2, 6% O2, and 90% N2). After 4 h, samples plates were quickly transferred to an ice water slurry and allowed to cool for 5 min to ensure minimal post-experiment metabolic activity. All subsequent sample handling was conducted in a 4°C cold room. Samples were transferred to 1.5 ml microfuge tubes, centrifuged (1 min, 10,000 × g) and sample media was harvested (50 uL for metabolite analysis, the remainder for pH measurement). Metabolites were extracted from each sample in 1 ml of 4°C 90% methanol. Insoluble debris was removed by centrifugation (10 min, 10,000 × g) and supernatants were transferred to fresh microfuge tubes and stored at -80°C until MS analysis. The pH of each media sample was then measured on a glass electrode. For MS analysis, samples were dried under N2 and resuspended in 200 μL HPLC-grade H2O. Insoluble debris was removed by centrifugation (10 min, 10,000 × g) and 50 μL aliquots of each supernatant were analyzed by high resolution mass spectrometry (Thermo Exactive) in negative mode using a 25-minute C18 gradient. Metabolites were identified and quantified using MAVEN.

Starting pH pH 6.7 pH 7.6 pH 8.6
Final pH Percoll enriched iRBC 6.3 7.1 7.5
Saponin isolated parasites 6.5 7.4 7.6
Uninfected RBC 6.9 7.5 7.7

templateInjector.prop:
Metabolite levels in infected red blood cells, saponin-purified parasites, and uninfected cells incubated for 4 hours in U-13 C glutamine containing media titrated to pH 6.4, 7.4, and 8.4.

Stacked bars indicate compound isotopomers incorporating differing levels of C resulting from metabolism of the U-13 C glutamine provided in the media. The bottom level of the stack is C12 (no incorporated C13) with higher levels of C13 being incorporated at higher levels in the stack.

Warning: all metabolite assignments provided in this alpha release should be treated as preliminary.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_interaction_LaCount_y2h_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Protein interaction network for P. falciparum derived from yeast two-hybrid studies.
datasetPresenter.description:
Protein interaction network for P. falciparum derived from yeast two-hybrid studies.

Complementary DNA was generated from poly(A)+ RNA isolated from mixed-staged (strain 3D7)-infected erythrocytes and inserted between the Gal4 transcriptional activation domain and the Schizosaccharomyces pombe URA4 coding region of pOAD.102 (prey plasmid) or the Gal4 DNA-binding domain and the S. cerevisiae MET2 coding region of pOBD.111 (bait plasmid). Yeast transformed with bait or prey plasmids were plated on medium lacking uracil (prey) or methionine (bait) to select for transformants expressing the markers fused to the cDNA inserts.

Yeast two-hybrid process
Individual bait colonies were picked at random and clonally expanded in liquid medium in 96-well plates. Aliquots from the prey libraries were added to each well; mating occurred overnight. Matings were plated on medium that selected for the mating event, the expression of the auxotrophic markers fused to the cDNA inserts, and the activity of the metabolic reporter genes ADE2 and HIS3. The cDNA inserts from yeast that grew on this selection medium were amplified by polymerase chain reaction and then sequenced. The identities of inserts were determined by querying the sequences against the annotated P. falciparum genes in PlasmoDB version 4.0 and the genome sequences from PlasmoDB version 3.3 that were excluded from version 4.0.

datasetPresenter.name: pknoH_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: genome sequence and annotation for Plasmodium knowlesi H
datasetPresenter.description:
P. knowlesi is predominantly a simian-infection malaria parasite, but also causes natural infection in humans, primarily in South East Asia. P. knowlesi was the first malaria parasite in which antigen variation was demonstrated. It has close phylogenetic relationship to P. vivax, the second most important species of human malaria parasite.

Sequencing Overview - see associated publication for full details
The random shotgun approach was used to obtain roughly eightfold coverage of the whole nuclear genome sequence from the erythrocyte stage of the Pk1(A+) clone of the H strain of P. knowlesi. The assembled P. knowlesi contigs were iteratively ordered and oriented by alignment to P. vivax assembled sequences and by manual checking. Automated predictions from the gene finding algorithms were manually reviewed by comparison to orthologues in other Plasmodium species. Artemis and Artemis Comparison Tool (ACT) were used for annotation and curation and viewing the TBLASTX comparisons of regions with conserved synteny between P. knowlesi, P. vivax and P. falciparum. This also allowed us to curate gene models and identify local interruptions of synteny. Functional annotations were based on standard protocols as described previously.

datasetPresenter.name: pvivP01_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome sequence and annotation for Plasmodium vivax P01
datasetPresenter.description:
A new Plasmodium vivax reference genome from a clinical isolate

In collaboration with the laboratory of Ric Price (Menzies School of Health Research, Darwin, Australia) we have generated a new reference genome for Plasmodium vivax from an Indonesian clinical isolate (May 2015). The isolate was sourced from a patient attending the Royal Darwin Hospital, Darwin, Australia, in 2010 who had recently returned from Papua Province, Indonesia. The patient blood sample was subject to leukodepletion using CF11 (Whatman) filtration but did not undergo culture adaptation. The assembly was generated from Illumina reads using the tools: velvet, PAGIT and REAPR. We were able to assemble large sections of the subtelomeric regions, resulting in a genome size of approximately 30 Mb consisting of less than 300 contigs. Annotation was transferred from the P. vivax Salvador I reference and additional, novel genes were identified ab initio and manually curated. This work was funded by the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute. The DNA was provided by Sarah Auburn and Ric Price (Menzies School of Health Research).The genome is described in the following publication: https://wellcomeopenresearch.org/articles/1-4/v1

Microarray expression data for P. berghei rings, young trophozoite, young schizont, mature schizont using mature trophozoite as reference.

Sample Preparation:
RNA was extracted from blood stage parasites of two P. berghei clones, a non-gametocyte producing clone HPE and a gametocyte producer clone HP (reference clone 15cy1) that were grown in highly synchronized in vitro cultures. Gametocyte RNA was extracted from immature and mature gametocytes that were obtained from synchronous in vivo infections of the HP clone, and purified from other blood stages.

Purified RNA was converted to cDNA, labeled with dye and hybridized to a 6.3 K P. berghei DNA microarray that was generated from a P. berghei genomic DNA library, supplied by J. Dame and J. M. Carlton (University of Florida).

datasetPresenter.summary: The RMgmDB is a database that curates, mostly from literature references, genetically modified parasites for P. berghei, P. chaubadi, and P. yoelii.
datasetPresenter.description: The Rodent Malaria genetically modified Parasites database is a web-based, manually curated, repository containing information on genetically modified rodent-malaria parasites generated by many labs worldwide. It contains data of 3 rodent malaria parasites: Plasmodium berghei, P. yoelii and P. chabaudi. The aim of this database is to provide the research community access to detailed information on the generation (e.g. disruption, tagging, mutation, transgene expression) and phenotype of mutant malaria parasites. The database also provides information on unpublished mutants without a clear phenotype and negative trials to modify genes.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_genomeFeature_Llinas_TransFactorBindingSites_GFF2_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: P. falciparum Trans-factor binding sites determined by protein binding microarray
datasetPresenter.description:
The DNA sequence motifs bound by each ApiAP2 transcription factor were derived from protein binding microarray data using P. falciparum AP2 domains. Protein binding microarrays are non-organism specific and contain matches to all contiguous 10-mers at least once and non-palindromic 8-mers up to 32 times. The DNA motifs were determined using purified recombinant AP2 domains and the resulting position weight matrix for each AP2 domain was used to search upstream regions for significant matches. The AP2 domain that binds to each motif is indicated at the end of the gene ID. Binding sites are based on sequence matches only and have not been verified in vivo.
For further information, contact Manuel Llinás: manuel@princeton.edu

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_Le_Roch_faire_chipSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Nucleosome occupancy across the P. falciparum 3D7 life cycle determined by ChIP-sequencing (FAIRE)
datasetPresenter.description:
Genome-wide maps of nucleosome occupancy across the parasite erythrocytic cycle were determined using one assay - the formaldehyde-assisted isolation of regulatory elements to extract protein-free DNA (FAIRE). This technique was coupled to high-throughput sequencing.

P. falciparum 3D7 parasite cultures were harvested 48 h after the first synchronizing sorbitol treatment (immediately after reinvasion, time point named T0) and then every 6 h for 36 h (respectively, T6, T12, T18, T24, T30, and T36). FAIRE procedures were performed and the resulting DNA was sequenced and mapped to the genome.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_Le_Roch_mnase_chipSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Nucleosome occupancy across the P. falciparum 3D7 life cycle determined by ChIP-sequencing (MAINE)
datasetPresenter.description:
Genome-wide maps of nucleosome occupancy across the parasite erythrocytic cycle were determined using one assay - the MNase-mediated purification of mononucleosomes to extract histone-bound DNA (MAINE). This technique was coupled to high-throughput sequencing.

P. falciparum 3D7 parasite cultures were harvested 48 h after the first synchronizing sorbitol treatment (immediately after reinvasion, time point named T0) and then every 6 h for 36 h (respectively, T6, T12, T18, T24, T30, and T36). MAINE procedures were performed and the resulting DNA was sequenced and mapped to the genome.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_PiggyBac_Clones_Adams_clonedInsertEnds_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genomic location of Lepidopteran transposon (piggyBac) insertions sites generated in P. falciparum NF54
datasetPresenter.description:
Genomic location of Lepidopteran transposon (piggyBac) insertions sites generated in P. falciparum (NF54).
piggyBac is a 'cut-and-paste' transposon that inserts into TTAA target sequences in the presence of a piggyBac transposase. Analyzing piggyBac instertion mutants for proliferation efficiency can reveal the function of the gene located at or near the insertion site. This data set shows the genomic location of piggyBac insertions in mutants generated for functinoal characterization of P. falciparum genes.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: P. falciparum (3D7) chromosomes sequence and annotation
datasetPresenter.description:
A high quality draft genome of Plasmodium falciparum 3D7 was produced by an international consortium in 2002 (Gardner et al., Nature 2002; 419:498-511). However, the completed genome, with no gaps, is being finished at the Sanger Institute. The latest version (v3.0) comprises systematically corrected and reassembled sequence, plus genome-wide re-annotation, incorporating annotations from a community annotation workshop, ongoing community feedback and detailed manual inspection by curation staff at the Sanger Institute. A manuscript describing the latest version is in preparation. We therefore request that you consult with the Principle Investigators before undertaking large scale analyses of the annotation or underlying sequence.
Contact webmaster@genedb.org for further details.

Previous to PlasmoDB release 9.0, the source of the sequence and annotation was the following:
Chromosome 1, 3-9 and 13 were sequenced at the Sanger Institute.
Chromosome 2, 10, 11 and 14 were sequenced at The Institute for Genomic Research and the Naval Medical Research Center.
Chromosome 12 was sequenced at the Stanford Genome Technology Center.

datasetPresenter.name: pyoeyoelii17X_microarrayExpression_Kappe_LiverStage_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Liver, mosquito and blood stage expression profiles
datasetPresenter.summary: P. yoelii liver, mosquito and erythrocyte stage gene expression analyzed by microarray
datasetPresenter.description:
Plasmodium yoelii liver, mosquito and erythrocyte stage gene expression was analyzed by oligonucleotide (65-mer) microarray. A total of 7 samples were analyzed.

3 liver stage samples: LS24, LS40 and LS50.
Liver stage parasites were purified from hepatoocytes collected from P.y-GFP-infected mice at 24, 40 and 50 hours post-infection .

2 sporozoite samples: ooSpz and sgSPz
Sporozoites were isolated from the the midguts (oocysts) of P. yoelii 17X infected A. stephensi mosquitoes at 10 days and from salivary glands at 15 days after an infectious blood meal (2 samples: ooSpz and sgSpz).

2 erythrocytic stage samples: Schz and BS
Schizont stage parasites were purified from overnight in vitro cultures of infected mice blood. Mixed erythrocytic stages were collected when parasitemia was at 5-10%.

templateInjector.prop:
ooSpz: Sporozoites from infected A. stephensi mosquitoes midguts (harvested 10 days after mosquito feeding)
sgSpz: Sporozoites from infected A. stephensi mosquitoes salivary glands (harvested 15 days after mosquito feeding)
LS24: Isolated liver stage infected hepatocytes 24 hrs after in vivo infection
LS40: Isolated liver stage infected hepatocytes 40 hrs after in vivo infection
LS50: Isolated liver stage infected hepatocytes 50 hrs after in vivo infection
Schz: Purified erythrocytic schizonts
BS: mixed erythrocytic stages when parasitemia was at 5-10%

Expression Values represent the relative expression level between pairs of conditions expressed as base-2 logarithms (note that M is in units of 2-fold change so in a comparison M = 0 denotes equal expression, M = +/-1 denotes a 2-fold difference in expression between the compared samples, etc.) - each is the average of all arrays representing the indicated comparison.
Percentile graph gives the expression percentile of the two conditions for each of the comparisons - each is the average percentile over all arrays representing that comparision.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_Stunnenberg_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: P. falciparum 3D7 transcriptome during intraerythrocytic development. Synchronized parasites were assayed by RNA-seq at 8 time-points during the iRBC cycle.
datasetPresenter.description:
Plasmodium falciparum 3D7 transcriptome sequencing during intraerythrocytic development.
Synchronized parasites were used to infect red blood cells. At 8 time points post-infection (5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30, 35 and 40 hours) RNA was purified, converted to cDNA and amplified via an unbiased linear amplification method. Illumina (Genome Analyzer IIx) sequencing was performed on each sample. Sequencing data is provided as unscaled and scaled to the RNA yield for that time point.

Scaled RNA Sequencing data:
We observed variation in overall transcriptional activity in the RNA yield from early invasion to the trophozoite stages. To provide better approximation of the true transcriptional activity, tag density (per 1000 bp) values at each stage were adjusted by a scaling factor derived from total RNA yield and the average number of nuclei, respectively The scaling factor was calculated by dividing total RNA yield by the average number of nuclei per parasite. Relative transcriptional activity of each euchromatic gene was calculated by dividing the scaled tag density at the particular stage by the sum of the scaled tag densities across all 8 stages.



Normalisation methods presume equal transcriptional activity across stages (i.e. normalize to total signal intensity of arrays or to total RNA-seq tag number for sequencing). However, transcriptional activity has been shown to significantly vary, being low after invasion of a red blood cell and reaching the highest level at trophozoite stage (Sims et al. Eukaryotic Cell, 2009). We observed this variation in overall transcriptional activity in the RNA yield from these stages (see Figure above). Therefore, to provide a better approximation of the true transcriptional activity, tag density (per 1000bp) values at each stage should be adjusted by a scaling factor (see table). This scaling factor is derived from total RNA yield divided by the number of nuclei per infected RBC, to yield a value for the total transcriptional activity per parasite nucleus.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_Su_seven_stages_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Transcriptomes of 7 sexual and asexual life stages
datasetPresenter.summary: Illumina-based sequencing of P.falciparum 3D7 mRNA from two gametocyte stages (II and V), ookinete, and four time points of erythrocytic stages representing ring, early trophozoite, late trophozoite, and schizont.
datasetPresenter.description:
Illumina-based sequencing of P.falciparum 3D7 mRNA from two gametocyte stages (II and V), ookinete, and four time points of erythrocytic stages representing ring, early trophozoite, late trophozoite, and schizont.

Using synchronized Plasmodium falciparum 3D7 parasites cultured for one full cycle, samples were harvested at 8, 19, 30, and 42 h post infection corresponding to ring, early trophozoite, late trophozoite, and schizont stages, respectively. Gametocytes were produced from asexual cultures harvested at day 8 (stage II gametocytes) and day 15 (stage V gametocytes). Ookinete were harvested from 30 mosquito midguts 24 h after a P. falciparum infected blood meal.

Seven bidirectional libraries from ring, early and late trophozoite, schizont, gametocyte II, gametocyte V, and ookinete, were sequenced using Illumina methods.

datasetPresenter.displayName: Strand specific transcriptomes of 4 life cycle stages
datasetPresenter.summary: Strand specific RNA-Seq coverage from four P. falciparum 3D7 life cycle stages: late trophozite, schizont, gametocyte II and gametocyte V.
datasetPresenter.description:
Strand specific Illumina-based sequencing of P.falciparum 3D7 mRNA from two gametocyte stages (II and V), and the erythrocytic stages, late trophozoite and schizont.

Using synchronized Plasmodium falciparum 3D7 parasites cultured for one full cycle, samples were harvested at 30, and 42 h post infection corresponding to late trophozoite, and schizont stages, respectively. Gametocytes were produced from asexual cultures harvested at day 8 (stage II gametocytes) and day 15 (stage V gametocytes).

Four strand specific libraries from late trophozoite, schizont, gametocyte II and gametocyte V were sequenced using Illumina methods.

datasetPresenter.name: pvivP01_microarrayExpression_Westenberger_array_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Westenberger P vivax Expression Data
datasetPresenter.description:
Sporozoites were purified from dissected mosquitoes fed on monkeys infected with P. vivax Salvador I at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Atlanta, Georgia. Asexual blood stage parasites were obtained from P. vivax-infected patients in Iquitos, Peru. White blood cells were removed by CF-11 cellulose column filtration, asexual parasites were enriched by gradient centrifugation and purified by saponin lysis of RBCs. Total RNA was isolated from purified parasites and subjected to two rounds of RNA amplification for microarray analysis as described previously (Zhou, et al. 2008). Experimental technical replicate hybridizations were performed for the single sporozoite sample and two asexual samples (CM012 and CM013). Gene expression values were calculated using MOID; expression profiles were clustered using OPI as described previously (Zhou, et al. 2008).

Scott J Westenberger, Colleen M McClean, Rana Chattopadhyay, Neekesh V Dharia, Jane M Carlton, John W Barnwell, William E Collins, Stephen L Hoffman, Yingyao Zhou, Joseph M Vinetz, Elizabeth A Winzeler. Plasmodium vivax transcriptome analysis reveals divergent in vivo blood stage profiles and species-specific sporozoite gene expression. (in submission)

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_chipChipExper_Till_Voss_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome-wide localization of heterochromatin protein 1 (PfHP1) as determined by high-density ChIP-on-chip.
datasetPresenter.description:
Genome-wide localization of heterochromatin protein 1 (PfHP1) and association with virulence clusters as determined by high-density ChIP-on-chip.

High-resolution analysis by genome-wide chromatin immunoprecipitation (ChIP-on-chip) revealed a striking PfHP1 occupancy pattern restricted to 425 genes, most of which are members of P. falciparum-specific exported virulence families including var genes, rifs, stevor, pfmc-2tm and others.

Contact Till Voss, till.voss@unibas.ch, for further information

datasetPresenter.summary: ChIP-Chip analysis to identify histone modifications (H3K9me3, H3K9Ac, H3K4me3, H4K20me3) in Plasmodium falciparum 3D7 wild type and Sir2 knockouts.
datasetPresenter.description:
Chromatin immunoprecipitation followed by microarray analysis to identify histone modifications (H3K9me3, H3K9Ac, H3K4me3, H4K20me3) in Plasmodium falciparum 3D7 wild type and Sir2 knockouts.

Chromatin immunoprecipitation assays were carried out using ring stage unselected 3D7 parasites.

Microarray was performed using a custom-made high-resolution tiling array covering coding, intergenic, and also noncoding subtelomeric regions. The design of the array was done with the assistance of NimbleGen Systems Inc. The P. falciparum 3D7 genome sequence was downloaded from The Sanger Center website and subjected to several iterative rounds of probe selection.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_Stunnenberg_DBP_chipSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Nucleosome occupancy determined by ChIP-Seq using micrococcal nuclease.
datasetPresenter.description:
The genomic position of nucleosome binding in P. falciparum 3D7 was determined using ChIP-sequencing.

Sample Preparation and Sequencing:
Tightly synchronized Plasmodium falciparum 3D7 parasites expressing (primarily) a single var gene (var2csa) were harvested at 8 time-points during intra-erythrocytic development (5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30, 35, 40 hours post-invasion). Formaldehyde cross-linked nuclei were treated with micrococcal nuclease (MNAse) and Exonuclease III to generate primarily mono-nucleosomal fragments. Sequencing libraries were prepared directly from digested chromatin fragments (called inputs) using a Plasmodium optimized protocol for KAPA polymerase-mediated PCR amplification (9 cycles) and without size-selection during library preparation (meaning all size range will be included in the library and in silico size-selection on the paired-end sequenced library can be performed later on where appropriate). Samples were sequenced 100bases paired-end on an Illumina HiSeq2000, but mapped using 72base reads from either side resulting in ~29-45 M mapped fragments/sample.

Sample names:
T5_input
T10_input
T15_input
T20_input
T25_input
T30_input
T35_input
T40(combined)_input

Controls (not automatically displayed): Several controls were included in this dataset;
i) a genomic DNA control (sonicated to the approximate size-range of our MNase/ExoIII libraries) to correct for any biases introduced during library preparation, sequencing and subsequent analysis;
ii) a technical replicate of the T40 MNaseSeq sample (called T40A and T40B) The track T40(combined) displays the reads from both replicates pooled together. Biological material from the same nuclear collection was independently digested and worked-up to assess variability between sequencing libraries resulting from technical instead of biological causes;
iii) H4-ChIP on the T40-chromatin using an anti-H4-core antibody. As the X-ChIP procedure itself seems to result in a modest depletion of AT-rich intergenic sequences compared to input libraries and potentially will ChIP differentially-modified nucleosomes with different efficiencies, we decided it would be more appropriate to perform nucleosome positioning on the input libraries. However, for comparison (to other datasets) we included an H4-ChIPPed library for the T40 stage.

Sample names of experimental controls:
T40A_input
T40B_input
T40_ChIP
gDNA

datasetPresenter.name: pyoeyoelii17X_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome Sequence and Annotation of P. yoelii 17X
datasetPresenter.description:
This is a completed genome (version 3), in 14 pieces with no gaps of a non-lethal P. yoelii yoelii 17X clone. The assembly was made by Martin Hunt and Alan Tracey using the HGAP assembler and long single-molecule sequencing reads from the Pacific Biosciences RSII technology. The HGAP assembly was manually finished using GAP5 (http://www.sanger.ac.uk/science/tools/gap5) and single base errors and indels corrected using icorn (https://www.sanger.ac.uk/resources/software/pagit). Annotation was transferred from P. yoelii yoelii 17X v2.

This work was funded by the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute. The DNA was provided by Tony Holder and Solabomi Ogun (Division of Parasitology, MRC National Institute for Medical Research, Mill Hill, London.

datasetPresenter.summary: Genome Sequence and Annotation for P. yoelii yoelii YM
datasetPresenter.description:
The assembly of P. yoelii yoelii YM was made using short-fragment Illumina reads and scaffolded with 454 paired-reads from a 3kb library. The assembly was computationally improved using PAGIT and annotated by transfer from the P. berghei ANKA reference. Genes in subtelomeric regions were predicted ab initio. The annotation has been manually re-inspected genome-wide.

This work was funded by the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute and the European Union's 7th Framework Programme (FP7/2007-2013) under grant agreement no242095.

The DNA was provided by Tony Holder and Solabomi Ogun (Division of Parasitology, MRC National Institute for Medical Research, Mill Hill, London).

datasetPresenter.name: pcynB_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome Sequence and annotation for Plasmodium cynomolgi B
datasetPresenter.description:
Plasmodium cynomolgi is a malaria-causing parasite of Asian Old World monkeys and is the sister taxon of P. vivax.

A combination of Sanger, Roche 454 and Illumina chemistries was employed to generate a high-quality reference assembly at 161-fold coverage, consisting of 14 supercontigs (corresponding to the 14 parasite chromosomes) and ~1,649 unassigned contigs, comprising a total length of ~26.2 Mb.

The Plasmodium cynomolgi B strain genome was sequenced using 454, Illumina and ABI 3730 technologies to 161x coverage. The genome was assembled using GS De Novo Assembler v. 2.0, mapping on the genome sequence of the P. vivax Sal-I, validation by mapping paired-end reads from fosmid clones using blastn, PCR across sequence gaps and finally, manual corrections.

EuPathDB downloaded the data from GenBank.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_microarrayExpression_E-MEXP-128_IsogenicClonesStages_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Transcriptomes of two isogenic P. falciparum clones (3D7S8.4 and 3D7AH1S2) of distinct adhesive and antigenic phenotypes determined using a P. falciparum 70-mer oligonucleotide microarray.
datasetPresenter.description: Antigenic variation is a survival mechanism developed by the malaria parasite P. falciparum in order to allow for the establishment of a chronic infection. Here we have studied clonal differences in the transcriptomes of two isogenic P. falciparum clones (3D7S8.4 and 3D7AH1S2) of distinct adhesive and antigenic phenotypes employing a P. falciparum 70-mer oligonucleotide microarray. Fifteen transcripts were highly differentially expressed (greater than a 5-fold change) with five transcripts upregulated in 3D7AH1S2 compared to 3D7S8.4, and ten downregulated. Identified genes encode apical organellar (Gbph2, GBP-related antigen), cell cycle and DNA/RNA processing (SERA-5, RNA-methylase), cell-rescue, defense/virulence (RESA-2, RIFIN, PfEMP1) and hypothetical proteins (PFB0115w, PFI1445w, MAL13P1.121). A number of short and full-length var transcripts were differentially expressed between the clones but one full-length transcript was dominant in both rings and trophozoites (PFD0630c versus PFF0845c). Distinct members of two other variant gene families (phist-a and rif-like), scattered over the subtelomeric areas of the 14 chromosomes, were also found to be clonally and developmentally expressed. Three sibling-clones of 3D7AH1S2 (3D7AH1S1, -S3, -S4) were further studied for the expression of transcripts upregulated in 3D7AH1S2 compared to 3D7S8.4. Individual var and phist-a genes were found expressed in all of the clones while the expression of a rif-like gene and gbph2 varied in-between the clones. The present data provides evidence for complex transcriptional differences between closely related isogenic P. falciparum of distinct adhesive and antigenic characteristics.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_microarrayExpression_GSE12515_HB3XDD2_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: eQTL for HB3, Dd2 and 34 progeny
datasetPresenter.summary: Expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) determined by genome-wide expression profiling of P. falciparum HB3 (drug sensitive), Dd2 (drug resistant), and 34 progeny of an HB3-Dd2 cross.
datasetPresenter.description:
Author Summary
Using cDNA microarray hybridizations from the progeny of a Plasmodium genetic cross, we mapped gene expression quantitative trait loci (eQTLs) in an experimental population of malaria parasites. Each gene’s transcript level was used as a segregating phenotype to identify regions of the Plasmodium genome dictating transcriptional variation. Several regulatory hotspots controlled the majority of gene expression variation, mostly via trans-acting mechanisms.

Experiment Summary
Genome-wide expression profiling and linkage analysis was applied to P. falciparum clones derived from a Dd2 - HB3 genetic cross to locate regions of the genome contributing to heritable levels of transcriptional variation that distinguish parasite strains. Using DNA microarrays, relative gene expression levels were measured in 34 progeny from a genetic cross of P. falciparum HB3, which is drug sensitive, and Dd2, which is drug resistant. For each progeny clone, relative transcript levels were determined for 7,665 probes representing 5,150 putative genes. Each progeny was previously genotyped for the 329 informative microsatellite markers spanning the 14 chromosomes (23 Mb) at a resolution of approximately 17 kb/cM. Interval mapping linkage analysis was performed using the Bayesian approach. Markers corresponding to the highest LOD score for each expression trait was retained as the eQTL position.

(percentile) expression percentile value.

datasetPresenter.summary: Proteomes depicting sporozoite maturation in the mosquito. Oocysts, oocyst-derived sporozoites and salivary gland sporozoites were collected from mosquitos (Anopheles stephensi Sind-Kasur) after infection with P. falciparum NF54 gametocytes. Complex protein mixtures from each sample were analyzed by 1DE, LC-MS/MS.
datasetPresenter.description:
Mass Spec of Mosquito oocysts and salivary gland sporozoites by Edwin Lasonder lab. Oocyst (OOC): 1-2 x 10^4 OOCs were collected from midguts of Anopheles stephensi mosquitoes (Sind-Kasur strain, 3-5 days old) 7-8 days after infection with P. falciparum gametocytes (NF54 strain). Oocyst-derived sporozoites (ODS): 1.4-3.8 x10^7 ODSs were collected from midguts of Anopheles stephensi mosquitoes (Sind-Kasur strain, 3-5 days old) 13-14 days after infection with P. falciparum gametocytes (NF54 strain). Salivary gland sporozoites (SGS): 1.3-2.5 x10^7 SGSs were collected from salivary glands of Anopheles stephensi mosquitoes (Sind-Kasur strain, 3-5 days old) 18-22 days after infection with P. falciparum gametocytes (NF54 strain). Please note that since samples were contaminated with host (mosquito) proteins, they were measured up to four times with exclusion lists to acquire MS/MS spectra of P. falciparum peptides. Sequenced peptides were excluded for sequencing in subsequent runs, resulting in an enrichment of low abundant peptides in LC-MS/MS runs.

Samples:
oocysts 7-8 days post-infection
oocyst-derived sporozoite 13-14 days post-infection
salivary gland sporozoites 18-22 days post-infection

datasetPresenter.description:
Transcriptional profile throughout the intraerythrocytic cycle of three distinct P. vivax isolates.

P. vivax infected blood samples were collected from three patients before they received standard chloroquine treatment. These synchronous, monoclonal, erythrocytic isolates were cultured ex vivo. Samples were collected at nine time points (9, 13, 17, 20, 23, 29, 35, 40 and 43 hr) representing the intraerythrocytic cycle from the early ring stage to the schizont stage. Samples were analyzed by genome-wide long oligonucleotide microarray.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_microarrayExpression_Derisi_HalfLife_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Genome-wide characterization of mRNA decay (microarray) during erythrocytic development of Plasmodium falciparum 3D7
datasetPresenter.description:
Genome-wide characterization of mRNA decay (microarray) during erythrocytic development of Plasmodium falciparum 3D7. These data provide an mRNA half life for ring, trophozoite, schizont and late schizont stage parasites.

Sample Collection:
Cells were synchronized by two consecutive sorbitol treatments during two consecutive cell cycles (a total of four treatments), and the mRNA decay experiments were conducted at 12-hour intervals starting in the ring stage (10 to 12 hours after invasion). To stop transcription actD (Amersham, Piscataway, NJ, USA) was added at 20 μg/ml, and samples were collected 0, 5, 10 15, 30, 60, 120, and 240 min.

DNA Microarray:
Total RNA was converted to cDNA, labeled with dye and hybridized to arrays. The DNA microarray used in this study contains 8,182 70-mer oligos. Of these, 6,652 are unique and map to an annotated ORF, as listed in PlasmoDB release 4.4. For the trophozoite, schizont, and late schizont decay experiments, the individual time points were hybridized in triplicate. For the ring decay experiment, the time points were hybridized in duplicate because of limiting quantities of RNA. In all cases, all time points for a single replicate were hybridized on the same day and included two replicates of the sample collected before addition of actD.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_microarrayExpression_E-MTAB-673_Transcrp_Variantome_3D7_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Asexual blood stage transcriptomes of clonal strains
datasetPresenter.summary: Expression profiles of transcriptional variation between Plasmodium falciparum clonal strains (Cortes).
datasetPresenter.description:
To characterize transcriptional variation in P. falciparum, and to identify genes under clonally variant gene expression, the transcriptomes of P. falciparum strains, from four subclonal groups (3D7A/3D7B, 7G8, D10, HB3A/HB3B) were characterized. Estimated ages for each strain were calculated at each time point using a statistical-likelihood method and the relative expression levels were compared among members of each sub-clonal group.

The five parasite lines were tightly synchronized to a 0- to 5-h window, and RNA was obtained at seven time points along the asexual blood cycle. Relative transcript levels were determined by hybridizing samples against a common reference pool in a long-oligonucleotide microarray.

link.text: Saved Strategy to return genes showing variant expression among the 3D7 subclonal lines in the P.f. Transcriptal Variation microarray experiment(Image is reproduced from Genome Res. 2012;22(5):925-38 Rovira-Graells et al.)
Saved Strategy to return genes excluded from the P.f. Transcriptal Variation microarray experiment
RoviraGraells_SupplementalTable_S1 - The variantome of each subclonal group, based on the aMAFC (adjusted maximum average fold-change across half the time interval compared) score.

(exprn_val) left axis : Expression Value (log-ratio) - The expression value plotted is the log-ratio of the comparator / common reference. A value > 1 indicates

                    right axis : Fold Change - A value of "2" means the relative expression of the comparator is double the expression of the reference. A value of "-2"
                    means the relative expression of the comparator is half the expression of the reference.
(CGH) The copy-number variation, based on hybridiztion against 3D7-A gDNA expressed as a log2 ratio

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_massSpec_Lasonder_Blood_Stages_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Gametocytogenesis: trophozoite vs early or late gametocytes (3D7, NF54)
datasetPresenter.summary: Proteomics analysis gametocyte stages of P. falciparum analyzing trophozoites and early and mature gametocytes.
datasetPresenter.description: Gametocyte-free trophozoites of P. falciparum were obtained from clone F12, a 3D7A derivative which fails to produce the early gametocyte stages. Early developing gametocytes (Early stage I-II gametocytes) were obtained using a three-step purification process of transgenic 3D7A parasites expressing a Pfg27-GFP fusion protein (expressed early in sexual differentiation). Mature gametocytes (Late stage V gametocytes) were obtained by Percoll purification of mature gametocyte cultures previously treated with N-acetylglucosamine to clear residual asexual parasites. Protein preparations from each parasite stage were analyzed by 1DE, LC-MS/MS.

datasetPresenter.name: pvivP01_massSpec_Patarroyo_Intraerythrocytic_Proteome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Proteome during the Plasmodium vivax VCG-1 intraerythrocytic life cycle
datasetPresenter.description:
P. vivax VCG-1 strain proteome during the intraerythrocytic life cycle.

RBCs infected with the Plasmodium vivax VCG-1 strain were obtained from in vivo propagation in Aotus monkeys. The P. vivax infected blood samples were collected for proteomic studies once parasitaemia percentage was found to be between 2 and 5. A sample from each P. vivax stage was collected when that stage represented more than 70% of all stages on a particular slide.

Peptide samples were analysed by LC–ESI–MS/MS. The Mascot algorithm was used for searching the acquired MS/MS spectra, using Thermo Scientific Proteome Discoverer software (v. 1.4.0.288) against the custom database of Plasmodium vivax Sal1 parasite (5389 amino acid sequences) in silico reference proteome, New World Monkey family (42,013 molecules) and common contaminant sequences (e.g., human keratins, trypsin, Lys-C and BSA), from the Uniprot protein database, release April 2014.

datasetPresenter.name: pberANKA_massSpec_MaleAndFemaleGametocytes_Waters_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Proteomes of highly purified male or female gametocytes from P. berghei ANKA were determined by 1DE, LC-MS/MS.

Two GFP transgenic lines (PbGFPcon, and PBGFPtub) were generated in the P. berghei ANKA strain. The sex-specific expression of GFP in the two clones was exploited to collect highly purified male or female gametocytes by Fluorescent Assisted Cell Sorting (FACS). datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_quantitativeMassSpec_Apicoplast_ER_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Apicoplast proteome determined by BioID followed by mass spec of P. falciparum Dd2 parasites during asexual blood-stage growth.
datasetPresenter.description:
BioID was used to perform large-scale identification of P. falciparum apicoplast proteins during asexual blood-stage growth. We achieved high positive predictive value of true apicoplast proteins by implementing an endoplasmic reticulum (ER) negative control to remove frequent contaminants expected based on the trafficking route of apicoplast proteins. Higher coverage was achieved by using the proteomic data set to develop an improved neural network prediction algorithm, ApicoPLAST Neural Network (PlastNN). The authors report a high-confidence apicoplast proteome of 346 proteins rich in novel and essential functions.

For large-scale identification of apicoplast proteins, biotinylated proteins from late-stage BioID–Ap and BioID–ER parasites were purified using streptavidin-conjugated beads and identified by mass spectrometry. A total of 728 unique P. falciparum proteins were detected in the apicoplast and/or ER based on presence in at least 2 of 4 biological replicates and at least 2 unique spectral matches in any single mass spectrometry run. The abundance of each protein in apicoplast and ER samples was calculated by summing the total MS1 area of all matched peptides and normalizing to the total MS1 area of all detected P. falciparum peptides within each mass spectrometry run.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_quantitativeMassSpec_Chakrabarti_Phosphoproteome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Proteome and phosphoproteome during intraerythrocytic development (Quantitative)
datasetPresenter.summary: Proteomic analysis of protein expression and phosphorylation of three stages of Plasmodium falciparum intraerythrocytic development
datasetPresenter.description:
Proteome of the Intraerythrocytic development cycle

Sample Preparation
Tightly synchronized ring (16 +/- 4 h postinvasion), trophozoites (26 +/- 4 h postinvasion), and schizonts (36 +/- 4 h postinvasion) were harvested, lysed with saponin, digested with LysC, labeled with one of 6 isobaric tags. The resulting peptides were fractionated into 20 fractions and either analyzed directly (global proteome) or enriched for phosphopeptides with immobilized metal affinity chromatography.

Proteomic Analyses
Both phospho-enriched and nonphospho-enriched samples were analyzed via LC-MS/MS on an LTQ-Velos-Orbitrap mass spectrometer. Peptides were identified by matching individual MS/MS spectra with peptide sequences using Sequest. For phospho-enriched samples, individual phosphorylation sites on each peptide were scored to assess how confidently the modification could be localized to a single residue using AScore.

Protein Quantification
Peptides matching each protein were grouped and their tandem mass tag (TMT) reporter ion intensities were scaled to a sum of 1.0. ANOVA was used to identify differentially expressed proteins based on the quantitation of individual peptides and Benjamini-Hochberg approach was used to correct for multiple hypothesis testing.

Note: The first release of this data only includes the protein quantification data. Peptides and phosphosite data will be available in the next release of PlasmoDB.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_microarrayExpression_Daily_Patients_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Distinct physiological states of malaria infected patients
datasetPresenter.summary: Steady state whole genome expression profiles of parasites derived from venous blood samples of 43 patients were determined using a previously reported custom made Affy array (Scrmalaria) based on the laboratory strain 3D7.
datasetPresenter.description:
The gene expression profiles of parasites derived directly from venous blood samples of 43 patients were determined by microarray. Patients resided in Senegal, had a diverse age range (8.366.9 years (mean6s.d.)), and diverse illness severity (parasitaemia 5.5%66.2%, haematocrit 32.366.8 (means6s.d.)).

Venous blood samples from P. falciparum-infected patients in Senegal were directly added to Tri-Reagent BD (Molecular Research Center). RNA was isolated, and steady-state parasite messenger RNA levels in 43 samples were determined with a custom-made Affymetrix chip based on the 3D7 genome.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_Newbold_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Transcriptome analysis of P. falciparum 3D7 at seven time points during the intraerythrocytic developmental cycle
datasetPresenter.description:
Transcriptome of P. falciparum 3D7 during intraerythrocytic development determined by RNA sequencing.

Synchronized Plasmodium falciparum 3D7 parasites were used to infect red blood cells. Parasite RNA samples were collected at seven different time points post-infection (0, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40 and 48 hours) thus capturing the entire intraerythrocytic developmental cycle from ring to mature schizonts. Total RNA samples were analyzed by Illumina sequencing. The raw sequence 37bp and 54 bp read data can be found at the European Nucleotide Archive (ENA) website study accession number ERP000069.

templateInjector.prop: Hours in the intraerythrocytic developmental cycle

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_Otto_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Seven time points in the P. falciparum intraerythrocytic developmental cycle were analyzed by RNA sequencing.
datasetPresenter.description: Highly synchronized Plasmodium falciparum 3D7 parasites were used to infect red blood cells. RNA samples at seven different time points were collected and analyzed by Illumina RNA-sequencing (37 and 54 bp reads). Samples were collected every 8 hours for 48 hours, thus capturing the entire intraerythrocytic developmental cycle from the ring stage to mature schizonts. Total RNA samples were processed and cDNA generated by reverse transcription using a 1:1 combination of oligo(dT) and random nonamer primers.

link.text: Raw data deposited at the European Nucleotide Archive (ENA); accession number ERP000069

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_microarrayExpression_Cowman_InvasionKOs_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Microarray analysis of P. falciparum wild type and knockout mutants that are deficient in the sialic acid-dependent ligands necessary for parasite invasion pathways into human erythrocytes.
datasetPresenter.description:
To investigate invasion pathways in Plasmodium falciparum, several knock out mutants were compared to wild type using microarray analysis. Knock out mutants were deficient in either parasite sialic acid-dependent invasion ligands (EBA140, EBA175, PfRh2b) or in Silent Information Regulator Two (Sir2). At several time points, RNA was isolated from synchronous late stage trophozoites/early schizonts and anayzed on high-density oligonucleotide arrays representing the complete genome of P. falciparum.

The malaria parasite, P. falciparum, exploits multiple ligand-receptor interactions, called invasion pathways, to invade the host erythrocyte. Strains of P. falciparum vary in their dependency on sialated red cell receptors for invasion. We show that switching from sialic acid-dependent to independent invasion is reversible and depends on parasite ligand utilisation. Expression of P. falciparum reticulocyte-binding like homologue 4 (PfRh4) correlates with sialic acid-independent invasion and PfRh4 is essential for switching invasion pathways. Differential activation of PfRh4 represents a novel mechanism of invasion pathway control and provides P.falciparum with exquisite adaptability in the face of erythrocyte receptor polymorphisms and host immune responses. (taken from GEO record GSE2878).

link.text: Data on GEO for accession GSE2878

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_microarrayExpression_GSE10022_CQ_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Three Isogenic Lines w/ CQ Treatment: expression profiles
datasetPresenter.summary: Chloroquine induced changes in gene expression were assayed by microarray in three isogenic clones that have differing drug resistance profiles.
datasetPresenter.description:
Chloroquine induced gene expression changes in three isogenic Plasmodium falciparum cell lines.
Three isogenic Plasmodium falciparum clones that have different drug resistance profiles corresponding to unique mutations in the pfcrt gene were incubated for 3 hours with and without chloroquine prior to RNA isolation and microarray analysis. The parent cell line P. falciparum isolate 106/1K76 (chloroquine sensitive, quinine resistant) and its two isogenic PfCRT mutants 106/76I (chloroquine resistant, quinine sensitive) and 10676I-352K (chloroquine sensitive, quinine resistant) were used in this study The A-AFFY-102 - Affymetrix GeneChip Plasmodium/Anopheles Genome Array was used to generate gene expression profiles.

datasetPresenter.displayName: Phenotypes from the database of Rodent Malaria genetically modified Parasites (RMgm)
datasetPresenter.summary: Phenotype links from Rodent Malaria genetically modified Parasites (RMgm)
datasetPresenter.description: Phenotype links from Genetically Modified Rodent Malaria Parasites: Pberghei.eu hosts a database containing information on genetically modified rodent malaria parasite lines generated by many labs worldwide. Specifically, it contains data of three rodent malaria parasite species; Plasmodium berghei, P. yoelii and P. chabaudi. The aim of this database is to provide the research community access to detailed information on the generation (e.g. disruption, tagging, mutation, transgene expression) and phenotype of genetically modified malaria parasites. The database not only provides information on 'successful' mutants with a clear phenotype, but also (un)published mutants without a clear phenotype and (un)published negative trials to disrupt genes.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_dbxref_simple_gene2OntologyPatternIdenFromWinzeler_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: A novel knowledge-based clustering algorithm, ontology-based pattern identification (OPI) that uses current information regarding known sexual stage genes as a guide.
datasetPresenter.description: OPI utilizes classifications of gene function in the form of systematic gene annotations to generate gene clusters with greater specificity and statistical confidence than is possible using more routinely-used clustering methods such as the k-means clustering approach employed in the past. Using manually-assigned gene annotations for sexual development to guide OPI, a cluster of 246 genes possessing highly gametocyte-specific mRNA expression patterns was identified

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_SNP_Broad_gff_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Aligned genomic sequence reads - Dd2, HB3, and other partial strains
datasetPresenter.summary: Whole genome resequencing data from Plasmodium falciparum Dd2, HB3 and other partial strains were used to call SNPs and determine CNV at the gene and chromosome level.
datasetPresenter.description:
Whole genome resequencing data from Plasmodium falciparum Dd2, HB3 and other partial strains were analyzed for single nucleotide polymorphisms and copy number variation using Plasmodium falciparum 3D7 as a reference.

SNP analysis
Reads are aligned to the reference genome using Bowtie 2 and realigned around indels using GATK. SNPs, indels and concensus sequence are generated with VARSCAN and stored in the database.

CNV analysis
The median read depth is set to the organism's ploidy and each chromosome's median read depth is normalized to this value. Contigs that are not assigned to chromosomes are excluded from this analysis. Gene copy number is similarly calculated using a normalized read depth for each gene. To compare the number of genes in the resequenced genome to the reference genome, genes are grouped into clusters that are inferred to have originated by tandem duplication.

Reads are aligned to the reference genome using Bowtie 2 and realigned around indels using GATK. SNPs, indels and concensus sequence are generated with VARSCAN and stored in the database.

CNV analysis
The median read depth is set to the organism's ploidy and each chromosome's median read depth is normalized to this value. Contigs that are not assigned to chromosomes are excluded from this analysis. Gene copy number is similarly calculated using a normalized read depth for each gene. To compare the number of genes in the resequenced genome to the reference genome, genes are grouped into clusters that are inferred to have originated by tandem duplication.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_HTS_SNP_Conway_HTS_SNP_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Aligned genomic sequence reads - 65 Gambian Isolates
datasetPresenter.summary: Whole genome resequencing data from 65 Gambian clinical isolates of P. falciparum were used to call SNPs and determine CNV at the gene and chromosome level.
datasetPresenter.description:
Whole genome resequencing data from 65 Gambian clinical isolates of Plasmodium falciparum were analyzed for single nucleotide polymorphisms and copy number variation using Plasmodium falciparum 3D7 as a reference.

SNP analysis
Reads are aligned to the reference genome using Bowtie 2 and realigned around indels using GATK. SNPs, indels and concensus sequence are generated with VARSCAN and stored in the database.

CNV analysis
The median read depth is set to the organism's ploidy and each chromosome's median read depth is normalized to this value. Contigs that are not assigned to chromosomes are excluded from this analysis. Gene copy number is similarly calculated using a normalized read depth for each gene. To compare the number of genes in the resequenced genome to the reference genome, genes are grouped into clusters that are inferred to have originated by tandem duplication.
Author Summary:
To comprehensively survey for genes under balancing selection in the human malaria parasite Plasmodium falciparum, we generated paired-end short-read sequences of parasites without culture in clinical isolates from an endemic Gambian population from the Greater Banjul Area. These reads were mapped to the 3D7 strain reference genome to yield high-quality genome-wide coding sequence data for 65 isolates. Signatures of balancing selection were most common in genes with peak expression at the merozoite stage that invades erythrocytes. Members of the clag, PfMC-2TM, surfin, and msp3-like gene families were highly represented, the strongest signature being in the msp3-like gene PF10_0355.

Generating the resistant line:
Plasmodium falciparum Dd2 was incubated with and developed resistance to KAD707/GNF707, a member of the imidazolopiperazine class of drugs being developed for treating plasmodium infections. The resulting drug resistant cell line (KAD707A) and the drug sensitive parent cell line (KADdd2) were analyzed by high throughput sequencing. SNP analysis

CNV analysis

datasetPresenter.name: _phylogeny_phylogeneticProfiles_RSRC$
datasetPresenter.displayName: Phylogenetic profiles for P. falciparum and P. yoelii
datasetPresenter.summary: Phylogenetic profiles based on the presence or absence of all known P. falciparum and P. yoelii ORFs in 164 (for P.f) and 195(P.y) completely sequenced genomes were calculated.
datasetPresenter.description: Phylogenetic profiles based on the presence or absence of all known P. falciparum and P. yoelii ORFs in 164 (for P.f) and 195(P.y) completely sequenced genomes were calculated. Similarity between profiles is a good indicator of functional linkages between proteins (see Pellegrini et al., 1999). Data on ORFs with the most similar profiles to a given query ORF is also available, and can be used to establish the function of uncharacterized ORFs, based on the similarity of their profiles (see Date and Marcotte, 2003) with ORFs of known function.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_Bunnik_Asexual_Cell_Cycle_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Polysomal and steady-state asexual stage transcriptomes
datasetPresenter.summary: Transcriptome and translatome of the P. falciparum asexual cell cycle.
datasetPresenter.description:
Analysis of the levels of steady-state mRNA and polysome-associated mRNA at the ring, trophozoite, and schizont stages of the intra-erythrocytic cycle of P. falciparum 3D7 using Illumina sequencing.

For steady-state mRNA, total RNA was isolated followed by mRNA purification using poly-A selection. For the same time points, polysomes were isolated by sucrose density gradient centrifugation, also followed by mRNA purification using poly-A selection. mRNA was converted to double-stranded DNA. Library preparations for steady-state mRNA samples were performed using the NuGEN Encore Multiplexing System, while library preparations for polysomal mRNA samples were performed using the New England Biolabs NEBNext ChIP-Seq Library Preparation kit. For all library preparations, PCR amplifications were performed using KAPA HiFi HotStart Ready Mix.

templateInjector.prop: Hours in Plasmodium falciparum asexual cell cycle

datasetPresenter.name: pberANKA_Janse_Hoeijmakers_five_stages_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: PolyA+ RNA-seq coverage from five P. berghei ANKA life cycle stages: Ring, Trophozoite, Schizont, Gametocyte and Ookinete.
datasetPresenter.description:
Illumina-based sequencing of RNA from five different stages of P. berghei ANKA development (4h Ring, 16h Trophozoite, 22h Schizont, Gametocytes, 24h Ookinete). Except for the Ookinete stage, independent biological replicates were obtained for all other stages.

Trizol-extracted RNA was polyA-selected, hydrolyzed, converted to double-stranded cDNA and used to generate sequencing libraries using the Linear Amplification for Deep Sequencing (LADS) protocol. Samples were sequenced for 76 cycles from one end on an Illumina GAIIx.

Data generated in this study is part of a larger project describing three rodent genomes and their annotation and was generated in collaboration with the Welcome Trust Sanger Institute.

datasetPresenter.name: pcynM_Galinski_infected_Mmulatta_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.displayName: Transcriptome of P. cynomolgi during 100-day infection in M. mulatta
datasetPresenter.summary: P. cynomolgi transcriptome of whole blood and bone marrow collected during 100-day infection of M. mulatta
datasetPresenter.description:
Macaca mulatta infected with Plasmodium cynomolgi B strain to produce and integrate clinical, hematological, parasitological, and omics measures of acute primary infection and relapses.

Five M. mulatta were inoculated with 2000 P. cynomolgi B strain sporozoites. Parasitological and haematological data were collected daily to study the clinical presentations of primary infections and relapses. Peripheral blood and bone marrow aspirates were collected at specific time points during infection for transcriptomic analysis.

Detailed Description:
Malaria-naive male rhesus macaques (Macaca mulatta), approximately three years of age, were inoculated intravenously with salivary gland sporozoites isolated at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention from multiple Anopheles species (An. dirus, An. gambiae, and An. stephensi) and then profiled for clinical, parasitological, immunological, functional genomic, lipidomic, proteomic, and metabolomic measurements. The experiment was designed for 100 days, and pre- and post-100 day periods to prepare subjects and administer curative treatments respectively. The anti-malarial drug Artemether was subcuratively administered selectively to several subjects during the primary parasitemia to suppress clinical complications and to all animals for curative treatment of blood-stage infections to allow detection of relapses. One subject was euthanized during the 100-day experimental period due to clinical complications. The anti-malarial drugs Primaquine and Chloroquine were administered to all remaining subjects at the end of the study for curative treatment of the liver and blood-stage infections, respectively. Capillary blood samples were collected daily for the measurement of CBCs, reticulocytes, and parasitemias. Capillary blood samples were collected every other day to obtain plasma for metabolomic analysis. Venous blood and bone marrow samples were collected at seven time points for functional genomic, proteomic, lipidomic, and immunological analyses. The experimental design and protocols for this study were approved by the Emory University Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).

*Transfusion information here: README


Primate ID Baseline (Pre-infection) Acute Primary Post-peak Inter-relapse Relapse
RIc14 TP1 TP2 TP3 TP5, TP7 TP4, TP6
RSb14 TP1 TP2 TP3 TP5, TP7 TP4, TP6
RMe14 TP1 TP2 TP3 TP4, TP5, TP7 TP6
RFa14 TP1 TP2 TP3 TP4, TP5, TP6 TP7
RFv13 TP1 TP2 TP3 N/A N/A
* Note that while TP4 for Rlc14 is officially classified as a relapsing time point, consumers should be aware that these samples were collected at a time when the distinction between relapse and inter-relapse was subject to clinical interpretation and may be considered as having been collected during relapse resolution.

datasetPresenter.name: pfal3D7_massSpec_Chakrabarti_Phosphoproteome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: Phosphoproteomic analysis of Plasmodium falciparum 3D7 intraerythrocytic development
datasetPresenter.description:
Sample Preparation
Tightly synchronized rings (16 +/- 4 h postinvasion), trophozoites (26 +/- 4 h postinvasion), and schizonts (36 +/- 4 h postinvasion) were harvested from infected erythrocytes by lysing in 0.1% saponin and parasite extracts were prepared.

Analyze phosphorylation
Protein samples were digested with trypsin and labeled with TMT. Then the peptides were separated into fractions via SCX chromatography. Phosphorylated peptides were specifically pulled out from each of the SCX fractions by immobilized metal affinity chromatography (IMAC). These samples were finally analyzed on LTQ-Velos-Orbitrap mass spectrometer.

Data Analysis
Peptides were identified by matching individual MS/MS spectra with protein sequences using an algorithm called Sequest. These peptides were filtered to remove questionable identifications using a multivariate approach. Peptides were assembled into proteins and proteins were further filtered to ensure a protein-level false discovery rate of 1%. Individual phosphorylation sites on each peptide were scored to assess how confidently each modification could be localized to a single residue (S, T, or Y), given the overall peptide sequence and the observed MS/MS spectrum. Peptidesand proteins were filtered to deal with protein redundancy and a master list of all observed phosphorylation sites was created.

Data from the three samples were combined before loading into PlasmoDB.
